column5: Hey gang, looks like you had a great time up at Lakair. I'm thinking of a possible long weekend trip in August. Do they have a concrete boat launch on site, or nearby?  Thanks in advance!
yes they do have a concrete ramp

they do... but the water level is below it. My problems came when I got my 2 front wheels off the concrete.. (my fault) and had to try to pop the truck up over the ledge of the pads... anyways I had to be towed out... if you have 4 wheel drive you will be ok. Thanks again Tybo!
Thanks, I've got a mini van without 4x4. I'll check with the lodge or you guys before I go up.

This might be one of the times a front wheel drive might help at a ramp! The water is low but your front drive wheels should still be on the concrete. In any event, I'm sure Kevin's big Dodge won't be too far away to lend a hand.
agreed Brian, just make sure you're drive wheels are on the concrete pads and you should be fine! As I found out the hard way LOL
Were you trying to qualify for the next "Boat launch bozo" thread?
I was not qualifying, I was winning the race!
Stay in line with the patio stones.. DO NOT tuck in beside the dock. that cost me a $100 lamp last year... there is a boulder in the water there that you can't see! Mark the thang Kevin...
It is out of the water this year

Yeah - you can see the rock out of the water now.  There are two rows of concrete slabs, but ya got a few feet of sand before hitting the water.    Check out my other post, where I described some of the water hazards that I had found - mostly out in South Muskrat and on the way out there.  Even from the launch, it is a gradual incline going out into the water.  I had to float mine off this year.
